trans-unit.source: Used within the template of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid"></xref> to specify the location in the control's visual tree where the column headers are to be added.
This class generates the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridColumnHeader> instances that are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGrid> visual tree.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridColumnHeadersPresenter"></xref> class.
Called to arrange and size the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Control"></xref> object.
The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
The size of the control.
When overridden in a derived class, undoes the effects of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.PrepareContainerForItemOverride*> method.
The container element.
The item.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridColumnHeader"></xref> instance to contain a column header value.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridColumnHeader"></xref> instance.
Returns a geometry for a clipping mask.
The mask applies if the layout system attempts to arrange an element that is larger than the available display space.
This method override always returns a clipping geometry that is the same size as the column header, regardless of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.ClipToBounds%2A> property value.
The rendered size of the column header.
The clipping geometry.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child at the specified index.
This method override includes the column header drag indicator as a visual child.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child to return.
The child.
Determines if the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
The item to check.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is (or is eligible to be) its own container; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called to remeasure a control.
The available size that this element can give to child elements.
The size of the control, up to the maximum specified by constraint.
It's invoked whenever application code or internal processes call <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate*>.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DataGridColumnHeadersPresenterAutomationPeer"></xref> for this presenter.
A new automation peer for this presenter.
Prepares the specified element to display the specified item.
Element used to display the specified item.
Specified item.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> children in this presenter.
This method override includes the column header drag indicator as a visual child.
The number of visual children.
